title: Really
body:
"wow noob you've lost the game for us", **get's triple**, "oh wow nice sorry man ahahaha"
Yea ok suddenly everything is cool and I'm alright? This behaviour is not acceptable, everyone should be treated the same whether they do good or bad in a game.

replies.body:
nah I disagree. You played shit, he said something, you played better and he apologised and complemented you on your play.

http://www.knex.com/shop/16774/real-bridge-building/
hahaha what is with the link XD
it is a bridge building kit. To help him get over it.

No what I'm saying is that his mood changed throughout the game. He would get angry at anyone who died, it was stupid and ridiculous. Then we win a team fight and suddenly he's all happy and laughing.
His mood changed. Like a normal human being. So what?
I've had people abuse me for 10 minutes straight then I make a few small plays and they just apologise and start sucking my e-peen. It's disgusting.

I completely agree with you. This kind of crap just shows what a bunch of fickle, salty, whining babies there are on this server... and there are a lot of them. The irony that can be seen, by anyone who has competed at a high level in just about anything, is that this is a loser's mentality. That said, just be better than them. When they do it to others, stand up for them. In my experience on other servers, (sadly) there is a disproportionate amount of them on the OCE server. The only way that I can see that changing is if better people speak up when they have the chance (in-game). Will it always be effective? Nope. But the more good people speak up and bring a positive voice to the community, the more it will grow. I have little doubt that would then expand the player base (since fewer new and old players will be inclined to leave a less toxic environment). A bigger player base means better competition, a chance to actually have world class players coming from OCE, Riot paying more attention to the needs and wants of OCE, and on, and on.  So many problems with the server are actually connected to this issue (believe it or not). Yeah, no doubt stupid people are a problem on this server. Though, it isn't a problem that can't get better. The community needs to choose to make it better by speaking up when it happens and counter-acting it with positive support of our teammates and the community.  ~ quoteth The Guru

>The irony that can be seen, by anyone who has competed at a high level in just about anything, is that this is a loser's mentality.

I just want to point out, that though you may be right, we are human's and not robots and it can happen, hell i was on Nightblue's stream last night (Challenger jungler in NA) and because of how he was feeling he had sub mode on (much to the annoyance of non-subs) and was fairly tilted.

It does happen, and while it's the wrong thing to do to actually say it to your team, it happens none the less to everyone.
